data.title: Looks aren't everything
data.text: The food was over priced. Felt like I was just a dollar bill walking in through the doors.  The place looks' great but the are missing the real charm and sincere of the 50ish... that "soda shop" mentality... unless you're one of "gang" that hangs out there.

data.title: Fun place
data.text: Dropped in for a snack and a treat on a Saturday afternoon.  A street event meant the place was busy.  I ordered a root beer float with vanilla ice cream.  The soft drinks are bottled by Dublin and have a full rich flavor.  Great float.  We ordered an order of home cut fries.  Took a while to get them but they were fresh and hot.  Great 50's atmosphere with live music. [Check web site for schedule]  Seating available at counter and table.  Menu included standard sandwiches and such.  If in Harlingen don't muss it.

data.title: Great Burgers, oldies live bands, dance floor, serve beer & wine
data.text: This is an "old Time" Soda Shop in downtown Harlingen. It has live bands on certain nights for your listening and dancing pleasure. Their burgers are large and outstanding. A unique small, lively place to visit for the older and young patrons.

data.title: A Step Into the Past
data.text: We had taken a walking tour of Harlingen downtown and were told about the Soda Shop. After the tour we headed for the Soda Shop, hungry for a hamburger and weren't disappointed.  The hamburger basket was very good and the atmosphere was great inside the soda shop.  My husband was disappointed that they don't serve malts as well as sodas and shakes but the shakes we had were very good.

data.title: Nice 50 s atmosphere.
data.text: I visited with my family,  is a nice place to hang out like the burgers and oldies live music a lot of 50s memorabilia.

data.title: Soda fountain memories
data.text:
Stopped by for a quick lunch, and were warmly welcomed with a good burger and good service. The owner stopped by our table twice to check up and chat a little. He's trying to recreate an old drugstore soda fountain, and has made a good start of it, but still has a ways to go.
Would like to return a weekend evening for live entertainment, but enjoyed the time we had.

data.title: A Huge Disappointment
data.text: About 30 of us Winter Texans reserved tables last weekend. When we got there, they gave us space for about 20 people. We were very squished in. Then we started to order drinks. They had no hard liquor and no wine. After 20 minutes we received a drink. Then we tried to order supper. Everything I asked for they didn't have. I would recommend that they get some better management. If you can't deliver on the menu items, take them off and offer what you can. The entertainment was ok but the whole experience was terrible.

data.title: Fun Place
data.text: Oldies makes one of the best hamburgers in Harlingen.  They are hand crafted and succulent. The service is good and when there is live music, it's great fun.  It can get a little crowded, especially in the winter.  The music is Oldies, but what do you expect.  Fun old fashioned soda fountain, too.
